Title.evidence: In this prospective randomized controlled trial

Participants.evidence: Patients were included in the trial if they had a culture-positive aspiration and had not taken antibiotics within 2 weeks of the procedure.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomized to receive prophylactic antibiotics either before the skin incision or after a minimum of three sets of intraoperative cultures were obtained.

Objective.evidence: we determined the effect of a single dose of prophylactic antibiotics on cultures obtained at the time of revision arthroplasty.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Results between patients who did and did not receive antibiotics were compared using an equivalence test for proportion differences

Number_Analysed.evidence: Intraoperative cultures yielded the same organisms as preoperative cultures in 28 of 34 patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: statistically equivalent by TOST estimate: p = 0.0290
